MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Working with Landing Pages in Marketing Cloud Growth

To ensure that your customers get the best experience from your content, preview your landing page. To edit a published landing page, unpublish it and then edit URL details, search engine optimization (SEO) settings, and more.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or edit content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

any CMS workspace contributor role


To publish or unpublish content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

a CMS workspace contributor role of content admin or content manager

Landing pages are hosted on an automatically generated Experience Cloud site called Marketing Landing Pages. This site is only used for hosting landing pages and doesn’t need to be edited. To edit a landing page, go to your marketing workspace, and open the landing page in the content builder.

Configure SEO Page Properties

To improve your landing page’s visibility in organic search results, define search engine optimization (SEO) properties such as title, description, and head tags.

On the landing page content detail page, click Edit.
Click SEO.
Enter the public page title that appears in search results and on the user’s browser tab.
To control which page details appear in the search results, enter a description.
If SEO indexing is enabled and this field is blank, the search engine results display the first text that the search engine finds on the page.
To configure structured data, enter head tags.
Save your work, and publish the landing page.
Preview a Landing Page

You can preview a landing page as a guest user or an authenticated user. To preview as an authenticated user, you must be added as a contributor to the Marketing Landing Pages site. When you preview your landing page, also review any attached forms.

If your landing page references an image that has an external URL, it doesn’t appear correctly if its domain isn’t included in your trusted URL list. Add the domain to your trusted URL list in Setup.

Open the preview window.
When editing your landing page, in the main toolbar, click Preview.
From the landing page content detail page, click Preview.
To see your landing page in a different view mode, such as desktop or mobile, select an option in the Preview Device menu.
To see your landing page as an authenticated or guest user, select an option in the Preview As menu.
If your landing page includes forms, ensure that they display properly.
To edit a form on your landing page, go to your marketing workspace and open the form in the content builder.
Unpublish a Landing Page

To change your landing page back to draft status, make it no longer available to other content that uses it such as a form, and remove it from related flows, unpublish your landing page.

When you unpublish a landing page your site visitors can no longer access the public URL or URL alias.

To prevent a 404 error for visitors, set up a redirect URL on the landing page record to send your site visitors to a different URL.

Unpublish the landing page in one of these ways.
From the workspace content list, click the name of the landing page, and then click Unpublish on the landing page record.
From the workspace content list, click a row action menu, and then select Edit | Unpublish.

When you unpublish a landing page, it reverts to a draft state and can be republished.

Edit a Landing Page URL Redirect

To prevent a 404 error when people visit your landing page, set up a redirect URL to send visitors to a different URL.

When a URL alias is inactive, a URL redirect sends your landing page visitors to a different URL. A redirect URL must begin with https:// and contain fewer than 2,000 characters.

To edit a URL redirect, deactivate the URL alias.
Open the landing page content detail page and then click URL.
Click .
Enter a valid URL redirect.
Save your work.
